channel.title: Comments on: Bring SQL Server databases Online or Offline when running on Amazon RDS
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Yeah, you can. I haven’t tried it with this instance. Working on getting it done. Another huge issue is getting forcibly disconnected a lot. Which is making data integrity fun.

It’s SSIS bulk load when avail. trimmed to 32670 (IIRC) to a packet size so I don’t plug the hole. I have a blog coming. There isn’t much detail other than the point that you really need to consider these issues when you are doing a conversion to a cloud solution. Azure at least. I have RDS access now and I’m going to test it out next week at night when I have time. üôÇ

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Can you bcp into Azure from a local instance?

For example with Amazon RDS you can do the following

bcp store.dbo.customers in C:SOmeHugeDataFile.txt -n -S rds.SomeName.us-east-1.rds.amazon.com,4080 -U admin -P insecure -b 10000

Are you using SSIS fast load, how are you loading the data?

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Could just be network latency as well..or the network card is shared by a dozen other instances on Azure
item.content:encoded: Could just be network latency as well..or the network card is shared by a dozen other instances on Azure

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: I'm writing up my load to Azure. I wonder if we can set something up with the volume I'm pushing and have a comparison. This was the first chance I've had to really load a huge amount of data to Azure and I'm really disappointing. Tuning the packets, multi-stream...everything was done right. :(
item.content:encoded: I’m writing up my load to Azure. I wonder if we can set something up with the volume I’m pushing and have a comparison. This was the first chance I’ve had to really load a huge amount of data to Azure and I’m really disappointing. Tuning the packets, multi-stream…everything was done right. üôÅ
